Judul: SUBSURFACE VOID INVESTIGATION USING GROUND PENETRATING RADAR IN THE GARUDA WISNU KENCANA (GWK) BALI
Abstrak:
This paper aims to highlisght the use of the georadar as a useful prospecting technique to identify the areal density
and the geometrical features of Garuda Wisnu Kencana (GWK) statue located inside cultural park area in
Ungasan Bali. The existence of cavities or voids beneath underground can lead to a serious hazard of building
construction. Cavities typically develop beacuse of subsidence and erosion of the base and subgrade material.
Ground Penetrating Radar (GPR) is one of the most effective tool to GPR has advanced to a level where the
subsurface condition can be diagnosed with confidence. This method uses dielectric permittivity, conductivity, and
magnetic permeability. In January 2018 tomographic imaging of subsurface feature using GPR has been pursued
in GWK. This research was focused on analyzing the presence of cavities and other features using GPR modelling.
GPR measurement has been carried out using the RAMAC GPR instrumentation system of 200 MHz unshielded
antenna mode. We have performed forward modelling to simulate some conditions of subsurface. Interpreting
these reflecting includes measuring the arrival time and the amplitude of reflected signal. GPR technology is very
effective in identifying areas with changes in physical properties, including potentially hzardous voids. Voids can
be either air or water filled; each type of void has a very different GPR signature compared to limestone materials.
The result will be correlated with geoelectric interpretation results that have been acquired in July 2013. Regions
with amplitude contrast and hyperbolic indicate the presence of cement-filled cavities and other features in the
depth of 5-7 meters.
